result.execSummary:
The defendant Alan Ramirez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with 22CT242 in the House of Correction, credit of 3 days time served, Huber Privileges for work and school.
Sign up for probation no later than 9/14/22.

miscConds.notes:
- Submit a DNA sample by 9/14/22 and pay the surcharge during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept
- Pay ALL costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alan Ramirez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alan Ramirez in court.  Attorney Marc Efton Christopher in court for Alan Ramirez.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 5 MONTHS concurrent with 22CT242 in the House of Correction, credit of 3 days time served, Huber Privileges for work and school. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 9/14/22.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription
- Obtain/maintain full time school/work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Complete 20 hours of community service.
- Submit a DNA sample by 9/14/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay ALL costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report- 09-06-2022, filed.  rmm

Defendant Alan Ramirez in court with attorney Marc Efton Christopher.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom. Status conference held. Parties have reached a global resolution and Attorney Christopher is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report- 07-25-2022, filed.  rmm

Defendant Alan Ramirez in court with attorney Marc Efton Christopher.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alan Ramirez appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for status. Defense advises the court they are in receipt of discovery and request a status date. Court orders matter adjourned. 
Case remains calendared in Branch 01.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report- 05-20-2022, filed.  rmm

Defendant Alan Ramirez in court with attorneys Corey R. Flynn and Marc Christopher.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Court grants Atty. Flynn's motion to withdraw as the defendant has retained private counsel.  Atty. Christopher requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Status conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 019567,
Payable Number: 988743,
Receipt Number: 22RP008204,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.

Defendant Alan Ramirez in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Alan Ramirez in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alan Ramirez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
